# Load Packages
```{r}
library(terra)
library(sf)
library(sp)
library(ggpubr)
library(purrr)
```

# Load Data
```{r}
#Clear global environment
rm(list = ls())
setwd("~/Library/CloudStorage/GoogleDrive-asiakaiser@gmail.com/My Drive/Dissertation/Chapter 2/Chapter 2_R")

# Load in Data
cities.test <- read.csv("data/cities.csv")
cities.test <- cities.test[cities.test$X2023 >= 300000,]
tcc_path <- "data/nlcd_tcc_CONUS_2021_v2021-4/nlcd_tcc_conus_2021_v2021-4.tif"
imperv_path <- "data/nlcd_2021_impervious_l48_20230630/nlcd_2021_impervious_l48_20230630.img"

# Load rasters into R
tcc_ras <- rast(tcc_path)  # Tree canopy cover raster
imperv_ras <- rast(imperv_path)  # Imperviousness raster
```

# Extract Raster Data

Extract City Coordinates
```{r}
# Extract city coordinates
city_coords <- st_as_sf(cities.test, coords = c("Long", "Lat"), crs = 4326) # Use EPSG 4326 for WGS84
```

Extract Raster CRS
```{r}
# Get the CRS of the rasters (assuming both rasters have the same CRS)
crs_rasters <- crs(tcc_ras)
```

Create buffers and function to extract summed buffer values
#```{r}
# Create a 45 km buffer around cities
buffer_radius <- 45000  # 45,000 meters
cities_buffer <- st_transform(st_buffer(st_transform(city_coords, crs_rasters), dist = buffer_radius), crs_rasters)

# Function to extract summed raster values for buffers
extract_raster_sum <- function(raster, buffers) {
  extracted_values <- terra::extract(raster, as(buffers, "SpatVector"), fun = sum, na.rm = TRUE)
  extracted_values[, 2]  # Assuming the summed values are in the second column
}
```

Extract summed tree canopy cover and impervious surface values from each city
#```{r}
# Extract summed values for the 45 km buffer from both rasters
cities.test$tcc45km <- extract_raster_sum(tcc_ras, cities_buffer)
cities.test$imperv45km <- extract_raster_sum(imperv_ras, cities_buffer)

# View the final dataframe
print(cities.test)
```

### Project cities points onto rasters
```{r}
plot(tcc_ras,
     main = "Tree Canopy Cover")
plot(city_coords$geometry,
     pch = 19)
```

```{r}
plot(imperv_ras,
     main = "Impervious Surface")
plot(city_coords$geometry)
```
